sent a telegram announcing his arrival in London. He will be disappointed to find the Deanery vacant. I wrote several letters, & revised the proofs of my new volume of sermons. For some unimaginable reason the compositor has used the largest capitals for the Divine Name, wherever it appears, with the result that the pages have a crude & restless appearance, very annoying to the eye of the reader. Yet to correct this will imply a large number of alterations, & probably add considerably to the labour & cost of production, a circumstance not lightly to be dismissed as things now stand with us. However, I did make the corrections, & decided to let Macmillan take his own course with respect to them.
